p: A visual representation of the effects of R. vulgaris exposure on the dermis of Wistar rats is displayed in Fig. 4. R. vulgaris demonstrated a noteworthy skin reaction in one out of the three rats used. After exposure, the skin of rat one of the rats showed slight erythema after 4 h followed by moderate erythema and flaking of the skin after 24 h. The skin reaction resolved within 8 days.
